intro: Robiquetia adelineana, commonly known as the Adeline's orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring or early summer, producing clusters of pale yellow to greenish-white petals. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Robiquetia adelineana is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
